com.alexkasko.unsafe.offheap
Class OffHeapLongSorter

java.lang.Object
  com.alexkasko.unsafe.offheap.OffHeapLongSorter

public class OffHeapLongSorter
extends Object

alexkasko: borrowed from https://android.googlesource.com/platform/libcore/+/android-4.2.2_r1/luni/src/main/java/java/util/DualPivotQuicksort.java and adapted to OffHeapLongAddressable. This class implements the Dual-Pivot Quicksort algorithm by Vladimir Yaroslavskiy, Jon Bentley, and Joshua Bloch. The algorithm offers O(n log(n)) performance on many data sets that cause other quicksorts to degrade to quadratic performance, and is typically faster than traditional (one-pivot) Quicksort implementations.

Version:
2009.11.29 m765.827.12i
Author:
Vladimir Yaroslavskiy, Jon Bentley, Josh Bloch

sort

public static void sort(OffHeapLongAddressable a)
Sorts the specified off-heap collection into ascending order.

Parameters:

sort

public static void sort(OffHeapLongAddressable a,
                        long fromIndex,
                        long toIndex)
Sorts the specified range of the off-heap collection into ascending order. The range to be sorted extends from the index fromIndex, inclusive, to the index toIndex, exclusive. If fromIndex == toIndex, the range to be sorted is empty (and the call is a no-op).

Parameters:
a - the off-heap collection to be sorted
fromIndex - the index of the first element, inclusive, to be sorted
toIndex - the index of the last element, exclusive, to be sorted
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if (fromIndex < 0 || fromIndex > toIndex || toIndex > a.size())
